meanings.definition: The front side of a store facing the street.
meanings.sent1: The storefront of the shop had large windows.
meanings.sent2: Customers often stop to look at the products displayed in the storefront.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the storefront, thinking it was a giant scratching post.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a welcoming storefront, drawing people in with its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The colorful decorations on the storefront made it stand out from the other stores on the block.

meanings.definition: A business establishment with a storefront for selling goods or services.
meanings.sent1: The new bakery had a charming storefront that attracted many customers.
meanings.sent2: The storefront of the store was decorated with festive lights for the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The storefront of the ice cream shop looked like a delicious temptation for anyone passing by.
meanings.sent4: His words were the storefront of his personality, giving a glimpse of what lay inside.
meanings.sent5: The storefront of the cafe beckoned with the aroma of freshly brewed coffee.
